paper_abstract: We study univariate integration with the Gaussian weight for a positive variance alpha. This is done for the reproducing kernel Hilbert space with the Gaussian kernel for a positive shape parameter gamma. We study Gauss-Hermite quadratures, although this choice of quadratures may be questionable since polynomials do not belong to this space of functions. Nevertheless, we provide the explicit formula for the error of the Gauss-Hermite quadrature using n function values. In particular, for 2 alpha gamma (2)< 1 we have an exponential rate of convergence, and for 2 alpha gamma (2)=1 we have no convergence, whereas for 2 alpha gamma (2)> 1 we have an exponential divergence.
paper_title: Gauss-Hermite quadratures for functions from Hilbert spaces with Gaussian reproducing kernels
